text: In the early 1930s, a man named Zulis Bell and his nephew Bert Bell operated a country store along the Lampasas River in central Texas in an area that was known as McBryde Crossing. Ding Dong is situated on Farm to Market Road 195 along the Lampasas River, 8 mi (13 km) south of Killeen in southwestern Bell County. Ding Dong is served by the Killeen Independent School District. Sons of the Pioneers fiddler Hugh Farr was born in Ding Dong. Category:Towns in Texas
title: Ding Dong, Texas
